title: How to Infuse Vodka With Cherry

steps.headline: Find a re-seal-able, wide-mouthed container, such as a mason jar used for canning fruit (or clean and recycle a mayonnaise jar).
steps.description: Whichever container you choose, be certain that it is clean and has enough room to stir the mixture thoroughly.

steps.headline: Pour the bottle of vodka into your selected container.
Add the cleaned cherries into the container with the vodka and mix the ingredients together with a long-handled spoon.
Place a piece of wax paper over the rim of the container.
Tighten the lid of the container and check to ensure that the jar is tightly sealed.
Allow the mixture to sit in a warm, dry place for 2 days.
Stir or give the jar a light shake, three times a day.
Taste the vodka infusion after 2 days.
steps.description: While you may decide to let it sit 2 or 3 days longer for more cherry flavor, it’s unlikely that more flavor will be extracted after a period of 7 days.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture through a mesh strainer to remove the cherries

text: Find a re-seal-able, wide-mouthed container, such as a mason jar used for canning fruit (or clean and recycle a mayonnaise jar). Whichever container you choose, be certain that it is clean and has enough room to stir the mixture thoroughly. Pour the bottle of vodka into your selected container.  Add the cleaned cherries into the container with the vodka and mix the ingredients together with a long-handled spoon.  Place a piece of wax paper over the rim of the container.  Tighten the lid of the container and check to ensure that the jar is tightly sealed.  Allow the mixture to sit in a warm, dry place for 2 days.  Stir or give the jar a light shake, three times a day.  Taste the vodka infusion after 2 days. While you may decide to let it sit 2 or 3 days longer for more cherry flavor, it’s unlikely that more flavor will be extracted after a period of 7 days. Pour the mixture through a mesh strainer to remove the cherries  Serve in a decanter.
